qas.question: When did the Papal States exist?
In the Papal States, what is the name for the specified neighborhoods where Jews were required to live?
What promoted hatred of Jews because of their descent?
Where were Jews required to live outside of in the Papal States?
Who did not make a distinction between "good" and "bad" antisemitism?

plausible_answers.text: conspiracies to control newspapers, banks, and other institutions

qas.question: What conspiracies were alleged about the Catholic Church?

plausible_answers.text: hatred of Jews because of their descent

qas.question: What did the "bad" kind of antisemitism not promote?

context: In <b3_0>the Papal States<b3_0/>, which existed <a0_0>until 1870<a0_0/>, Jews were required to live only in <b4_0>specified neighborhoods called <a1_0>ghettos<b4_0/><a1_0/>. In the 19th and (before the end of World War II) 20th centuries, <b5_0>the Roman Catholic Church<b5_0/> adhered to a distinction between "good antisemitism" and "<a2_0>bad antisemitism<a2_0/>". The "bad" kind promoted <b7_0>hatred of Jews because of their descent<b7_0/>. This was considered un-Christian because the Christian message was intended for all of humanity regardless of ethnicity; anyone could become a Christian. The "good" kind criticized alleged Jewish <b6_0>conspiracies to control newspapers, banks, and other institutions<b6_0/>, to care only about accumulation of wealth, etc.
